speaker: Clown
text_entry: ACT I

speaker: Clown
text_entry: SCENE I. Verona. An open place.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Enter VALENTINE and PROTEUS

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: Cease to persuade, my loving Proteus:

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: Home-keeping youth have ever homely wits.

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: Were't not affection chains thy tender days

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: To the sweet glances of thy honour'd love,

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: I rather would entreat thy company

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: To see the wonders of the world abroad,

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: Than, living dully sluggardized at home,

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: Wear out thy youth with shapeless idleness.

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: But since thou lovest, love still and thrive therein,

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: Even as I would when I to love begin.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Wilt thou be gone? Sweet Valentine, adieu!

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Think on thy Proteus, when thou haply seest

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Some rare note-worthy object in thy travel:

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Wish me partaker in thy happiness

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: When thou dost meet good hap; and in thy danger,

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: If ever danger do environ thee,

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Commend thy grievance to my holy prayers,

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: For I will be thy beadsman, Valentine.

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: And on a love-book pray for my success?

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Upon some book I love I'll pray for thee.

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: That's on some shallow story of deep love:

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: How young Leander cross'd the Hellespont.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: That's a deep story of a deeper love:

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: For he was more than over shoes in love.

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: 'Tis true; for you are over boots in love,

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: And yet you never swum the Hellespont.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Over the boots? nay, give me not the boots.

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: No, I will not, for it boots thee not.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: What?

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: To be in love, where scorn is bought with groans;

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: Coy looks with heart-sore sighs; one fading moment's mirth

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: With twenty watchful, weary, tedious nights:

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: If haply won, perhaps a hapless gain;

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: If lost, why then a grievous labour won;

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: However, but a folly bought with wit,

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: Or else a wit by folly vanquished.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: So, by your circumstance, you call me fool.

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: So, by your circumstance, I fear you'll prove.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: 'Tis love you cavil at: I am not Love.

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: Love is your master, for he masters you:

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: And he that is so yoked by a fool,

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: Methinks, should not be chronicled for wise.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Yet writers say, as in the sweetest bud

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: The eating canker dwells, so eating love

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Inhabits in the finest wits of all.

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: And writers say, as the most forward bud

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: Is eaten by the canker ere it blow,

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: Even so by love the young and tender wit

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: Is turn'd to folly, blasting in the bud,

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: Losing his verdure even in the prime

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: And all the fair effects of future hopes.

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: But wherefore waste I time to counsel thee,

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: That art a votary to fond desire?

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: Once more adieu! my father at the road

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: Expects my coming, there to see me shipp'd.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: And thither will I bring thee, Valentine.

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: Sweet Proteus, no; now let us take our leave.

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: To Milan let me hear from thee by letters

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: Of thy success in love, and what news else

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: Betideth here in absence of thy friend;

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: And likewise will visit thee with mine.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: All happiness bechance to thee in Milan!

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: As much to you at home! and so, farewell.

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: Exit

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: He after honour hunts, I after love:

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: He leaves his friends to dignify them more,

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: I leave myself, my friends and all, for love.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Thou, Julia, thou hast metamorphosed me,

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Made me neglect my studies, lose my time,

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: War with good counsel, set the world at nought;

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Made wit with musing weak, heart sick with thought.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Enter SPEED

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: Sir Proteus, save you! Saw you my master?

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: But now he parted hence, to embark for Milan.

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: Twenty to one then he is shipp'd already,

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: And I have play'd the sheep in losing him.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Indeed, a sheep doth very often stray,

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: An if the shepherd be a while away.

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: You conclude that my master is a shepherd, then,

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: and I a sheep?

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: I do.

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: Why then, my horns are his horns, whether I wake or sleep.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: A silly answer and fitting well a sheep.

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: This proves me still a sheep.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: True; and thy master a shepherd.

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: Nay, that I can deny by a circumstance.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: It shall go hard but I'll prove it by another.

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: The shepherd seeks the sheep, and not the sheep the

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: shepherd; but I seek my master, and my master seeks

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: not me: therefore I am no sheep.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: The sheep for fodder follow the shepherd; the

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: shepherd for food follows not the sheep: thou for

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: wages followest thy master; thy master for wages

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: follows not thee: therefore thou art a sheep.

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: Such another proof will make me cry 'baa.'

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: But, dost thou hear? gavest thou my letter to Julia?

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: Ay sir: I, a lost mutton, gave your letter to her,

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: a laced mutton, and she, a laced mutton, gave me, a

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: lost mutton, nothing for my labour.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Here's too small a pasture for such store of muttons.

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: If the ground be overcharged, you were best stick her.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Nay: in that you are astray, 'twere best pound you.

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: Nay, sir, less than a pound shall serve me for

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: carrying your letter.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: You mistake; I mean the pound,--a pinfold.

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: From a pound to a pin? fold it over and over,

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: 'Tis threefold too little for carrying a letter to

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: your lover.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: But what said she?

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: [First nodding]  Ay.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Nod--Ay--why, that's noddy.

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: You mistook, sir; I say, she did nod: and you ask

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: me if she did nod; and I say, 'Ay.'

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: And that set together is noddy.

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: Now you have taken the pains to set it together,

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: take it for your pains.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: No, no; you shall have it for bearing the letter.

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: Well, I perceive I must be fain to bear with you.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Why sir, how do you bear with me?

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: Marry, sir, the letter, very orderly; having nothing

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: but the word 'noddy' for my pains.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Beshrew me, but you have a quick wit.

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: And yet it cannot overtake your slow purse.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Come come, open the matter in brief: what said she?

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: Open your purse, that the money and the matter may

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: be both at once delivered.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Well, sir, here is for your pains. What said she?

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: Truly, sir, I think you'll hardly win her.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Why, couldst thou perceive so much from her?

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: Sir, I could perceive nothing at all from her; no,

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: not so much as a ducat for delivering your letter:

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: and being so hard to me that brought your mind, I

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: fear she'll prove as hard to you in telling your

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: mind. Give her no token but stones; for she's as

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: hard as steel.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: What said she? nothing?

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: No, not so much as 'Take this for thy pains.' To

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: testify your bounty, I thank you, you have testerned

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: me; in requital whereof, henceforth carry your

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: letters yourself: and so, sir, I'll commend you to my master.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Go, go, be gone, to save your ship from wreck,

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Which cannot perish having thee aboard,

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Being destined to a drier death on shore.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Exit SPEED

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: I must go send some better messenger:

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: I fear my Julia would not deign my lines,

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Receiving them from such a worthless post.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Exit
